org.jlokalize
Class LanguageProperties

java.lang.Object
  org.jlokalize.LanguageProperties

public class LanguageProperties
extends java.lang.Object

This class wraps Property to track modifications (via a HashMap and the value null), to have some identifiers (base, language, country, variant) and to only work on text keys (no comment keys) but also work on comments simultaneously, therefore hiding these details from the higher level editor frame and table model.

public LanguageProperties()

LanguageProperties

public LanguageProperties(org.tools.i18n.Property prop)
Creates a language structure with a property already set. Copies to map. Is used for creating languages from a file.

Parameters:
prop - The property.

setClearName

public void setClearName()
Updates the clear name according to the language, country, variant and current Locale settings. If all of these are null, just use the base name.

The standard convention file name: base_language_country_variant (only for those who are not null).

Parameters:

containsAsKey

public boolean containsAsKey(java.lang.String key)
For those keys who are not ending with the commentID, i.e. are not comments, look if they are contained in the map. Used to determine status in the keys table.

Parameters:
key - The key.
Returns:
True if contained and not a comment key.

getKeyText

public java.lang.String getKeyText(java.lang.String key)
Returns the text content for a key which is not a comment key.

Parameters:
key - The key.
Returns:
The text of the key in the map or null if key is not contained in the map or if key is a comment key.

putKeyText

public void putKeyText(java.lang.String key,
                       java.lang.String text)
Sets new text for a key, potentially also adding new keys to the map.

Parameters:
key - The key (not ending with commentID)
text - The new text.

getKeyComment

public java.lang.String getKeyComment(java.lang.String key)
For a key (not ending with commentID), return the entry in the map if commentID is added. The comment for a key is the content of a key to whom the commentID is added.

Parameters:
key - The key.
Returns:
The comment content belonging to this key or null if no comment is existing.

putKeyComment

public void putKeyComment(java.lang.String key,
                          java.lang.String comment)
Sets new comment for a key, i.e. sets new text for a key who additionally has commentID added. Potentially a new key can be added here.

Parameters:
key - The key (without commentID).
comment - The new comment text.

removeKey

public void removeKey(java.lang.String key)
Removing the content of a key, i.e. putting null in the entry for the key and the commentID.

Parameters:
key - The key whose text and comment is removed.

renameKey

public void renameKey(java.lang.String oldKey,
                      java.lang.String newKey)
Renames a key, neither the old key nor the new key can end with commentID. Removes content of old key and inserts content for new key.

Parameters:
oldKey - The old key.
newKey - The new key.

modified

public boolean modified(java.lang.String key)
Determines if a key has been modified. Now there are different conditions which indicate that a key has been modified (relative to the original). We test for them all: - is only modified, if the key is contained (not ending with commentID) - is modified, if it is not contained in the original property (newly created) - if the content is null, then it was removed - if the content is not the same as the content of the original property (also if comments differ)

Parameters:
key - The key to test.
Returns:
True if modified.

restore

public void restore(java.lang.String key)
Restores the behavior of a key as it was during loading. First we remove completely the entries, then we copy from the original, but only if the original contains such a key.

Parameters:
key - The key to restore.

removeAllKeys

public void removeAllKeys()
On rare occasions we want to remove all keys. We do this directly here.

getAllTextKeysAsSet

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllTextKeysAsSet()
Get all valid keys (i.e. that not ending with commentID).

Returns:
A Set of keys.

anyKeyModified

public boolean anyKeyModified()
Tests all keys if they are modified.

Returns:
True if at least one key is modified.

save

public boolean save(org.tools.io.Resource resource)
Puts the current state into props and save them.

Parameters:
resource - The resource to save to.
Returns:
True, if saving was successfully.

isEqual

public boolean isEqual(LanguageProperties other)
Use for comparison (language, country, variant must be equal) to check if in the language tree there is already such a language.

Parameters:
other - Another object of this type.
Returns:
True if language, country and variant are equal.
